notes: 241 individuals, including up to 92 drug suspects, were arrested during a 'one-time big-time' police operation by the Metro Manila Northern Police District (NPD) in Caloocan on 1 October 2019.

On 3 October 2019, a soldier survived an ambush carried out by unidentified assailants along the junction of Notre Dame Avenue and Don Cesar Street in Cotabato City. Soldier assumed off-duty.

Two drug suspects were killed during a police raid at Barangay Caingin, San Rafael, Bulacan on 4 October 2019.

assoc_actor_1: ACT: Alliance of Concerned Teachers; Teachers (Philippines)

The demonstration in Mendiola was the focal point of the nationally-coordinated protest, which saw teachers across the country forming '30K' formations then taking to social media to dramatize their demand of P30,000 as entry-level pay. [size=no report]

On 4 October 2019, unidentified armed assailants abducted a British man and a Filipino woman in a resort in Alindahaw, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur.

source: Rappler; Philippine Daily Inquirer; ABS CBN
notes: On 4 October 2019, 7 members of Moro Islamic Liberation Front (MILF) were killed during a firefight with Dawlah Islamiya militants that lasted half a day in Shariff Saydona Mustapha, Maguindanao. The MILF recently began decommissioning its weapons as part of the 2014 peace plan. In recent years, they have assisted the military in fighting Islamist groups in the region.

On Oct 5, 2019, a drug suspect was killed while another was wounded in an encounter with the police at the intersection of Mount Vernon Street and Gil Fernando Avenue in Marikina City. The accused police officer had already accosted the victims earlier that night, accusing them of being drug users, and later shot at them when they coincidentally ran into each other again that same night.

On 6 October 2019, an Abu Sayyaf militant was killed and another was arrested in a 20-minute firefight between about 30 rebels and government troops in Sitio Kan Pataw, Barangay Upper Sinumaan, Talipao, Sulu. The military also retrieved weapons.

Marcos Jr. - demonstrated in support of Robredo in front of the Ateneo de Manila University along Katipunan Avenue, Quezon City. The Supreme Court decision on the electoral protest was expected the next day, but was postponed. [size=no report]

Marcos Jr. - demonstrated in support of Robredo in front of the Supreme Court's Baguio compound at Upper Session Road, Baguio. City officials took part in the demonstration. On 14 October 2019, suspected NPA militants fired upon and burned equipment belonging a construction firm in Barangay Campo, Bacuag, Surigao del Norte. The company is a contractor for a government road-widening project.

On 14 and 15 October 2019, fighting broke out between two rival Moro clans in a case of 'rido' (clan war) in Dungguan, Datu Montawal, Maguindanao, over a land dispute. There were MILF leaders and members in both warring clans. There were four reported fatalities and three were wounded. Four fatalities divided across two days of fighting.
A drug suspect was killed in a police raid in Barangay Caloocan, San Jose, Nueva Ecija on 14 October 2019.

On 14 October 2019, suspected militants of the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters carried out a grenade attack on St. Therese Church, a Catholic church in Datu Piang, Maguindanao. There were no reported casualties.
Three drug suspects were killed in a police raid in Barangay Sinakulay, President Quirino, Sultan Kudarat on 14 October 2019.

source: Philippine Daily Inquirer; CNN; ABS CBN; Cebu Daily News
notes: On 14 October 2019, Philippine National Police chief Oscar Albayalde stepped down from his post, following weeks of Senate investigations into his involvement in the practice of 'drug recycling,' i.e., the selling of confiscated drugs back in the black market by police officers (often called 'ninja cops'). On 16 January 2020, the Department of Justice in Manila announced that it had found probable cause to indict Albayalde and 12 others on charges of graft.

source: ABS CBN; Manila Bulletin; GMA News
notes: On 15 October 2019, four robbery suspects were killed in a shootout with the police along Payatas Road, Quezon City. The police also reported finding drugs on the four slain suspects, while four other robbery suspects escaped.

On 15 October 2019, government forces and Abu Sayyaf militants were engaged in a 20-minute firefight in Barangay Calang Canas, Maluso, Basilan. There were no military casualties and an undetermined number of casualties on the Abu Sayyaf side. The military also reported retrieving six IEDs.

source: Philippine Daily Inquirer; Manila Bulletin; Rappler; Philippine Star
notes: On 15 October 2019, over 200 students and faculty members demonstrated inside the campus of the Ateneo de Manila University in Quezon City against cases of sexual violence and impunity in the institution, as well as the alleged inaction of the administration. [size=over 200]
On 15 October 2019, a village councilor was shot dead by unidentified car-riding assailants in Barangay Libongao, Kananga, Leyte.

On 15 October 2019, about 15 members of Kabataan Partylist, students and other Cebu residents protested against the planned cutting down of century-old trees in Barangay Inoburan, Naga City, Cebu. [size=about 15]

As of 15 October 2019, 3,690 residents had fled the village of Dungguan, Datu Montawal, Maguindanao after warring broke out between two Moro clans over a land dispute. The clan war (called 'rido' locally) involved two competing families that had MILF leaders among its members.

On 14 and 15 October 2019, fighting continued between two rival Moro clans in a case of 'rido' (clan war) in Dungguan, Datu Montawal, Maguindanao, over a land dispute. There were MILF leaders and members in both warring clans. There were four reported fatalities and three were wounded. Four fatalities divided across two days of fighting.
On 15 October 2019, an assistant election officer was shot dead by unidentified assailants in Barangay Pongon, MacArthur, Leyte.

source: Philippine Daily Inquirer; GMA News; Sunstar (Philippines)
notes: On 15 October 2019, two teachers survived an attack by unidentified armed assailants in Dalet Elementary School, Barangay Lumbayao, Valencia, Bukidnon. One of the targets, a member of the Alliance of Concerned Teachers (ACT), was wounded. ACT alluded to 'state fascism' for the attack, while some reports pinned it on the NPA.

source: Philippine Daily Inquirer; Philippine Star; Abante
notes: On 16 October 2019, controversial police officer Jovie Espenido was named the new Bacolod City Police Deputy Director for Operations and will be tasked to lead the drug war in that city. It was under Espenido, during his two previous assignments, that two mayors suspected to have drug links were killed in high-profile police operations. Commenting on Espenido's new assignment, President Rodrigo Duterte said the next day that Espenido was 'free to kill everybody,' although the Philippine National Police later said that Espenido would be expected to act 'with utmost respect for human rights' and that Duterte's statement was just 'putting emphasis on his campaign promise to eradicate illegal drugs.'
Two drug suspects were killed during a police raid in Barangay Ibabang Iyam, Lucena, Quezon on 16 October 2019.
A drug suspect was killed in a police raid in Barangay San Jose, Santa Cruz, Laguna on 17 October 2019.

A drug suspect was shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified assailants in Barangay Carreta, Cebu City on 17 October 2019.
On 16-17 October 2019, 26 NPA members belonging to the Dumagat tribe surrendered to joint operatives of the military and the police in Quezon province.

notes: On 17 October 2019, a student of the Mindanao State University was shot by unidentified assailants inside the university campus in Barangay Dimalna, Marawi City. The student later died after being in a coma for several days. The reasons for the attack are unknown.

The demonstration, part of nationally-coordinated efforts that day, was also part of a series of actions organized for the month-long campaign 'Pagkakaisa at Paglaban para sa Lupa, Pagkain at Hustisya' ('Unity and Struggle for Land, Food and Justice') by the farmers' organization Danggayan-CV, the regional affiliate of the Kilusang Magbubukid ng Pilipinas (KMP). [size=no report]

Rioters threw glass bottles and Molotov bombs at the demolition team and the accompanying police, with some police officers reportedly getting wounded. [size=over 30 families]

source: Philippine News Agency; Philippine Daily Inquirer
notes: On 22 October 2019, a village chief was killed while his companion was wounded in an attack by unidentified motorcycle-riding assailants in Barangay Malipampang, San Ildefonso, Bulacan.

source: Philippine Daily Inquirer; Philippine Star; Abante
notes: On 23 October 2019, a police officer away from his assignment was shot dead by unidentified motorcycle-riding assailants in Barangay San Jose, Antipolo, Rizal. Police officer assumed off-duty.
A drug suspect was killed while another escaped in a police raid in Bustos, Bulacan on 23 October 2019.

source: Manila Bulletin; GMA News; Philippine Star; Abante; Philippine News Agency
notes: On 23 October 2019, seven alleged BIFF militants were killed in an encounter with government troops in Barangay Tumbras, Midsayap, Cotabato. The government reported no casualties and said it retrieved several weapons. However, the relatives of the fatalities later asserted that the seven killed were minors and not BIFF militants. The army, noting that one of the slain had long been wanted, simply replied that this showed the BIFF had 'child warriors.'
A drug suspect was killed in a police raid in Barangay Guijo, San Jose del Monte, Bulacan on 23 October 2019.

On 24 October 2019, a soldier was killed while a police officer was wounded in a 10-minute clash with suspected NPA militants in Barangay Suguib, Besao, Mountain Province. There were no reported NPA casualties.

On 24 October 2019, suspected NPA militants and government troops engaged in a firefight in Barangay Rizal, Batuan, Bohol. There were no reported casualties on both sides. The incident is notable according to news reports because Bohol had been declared 'insurgency-free' by the military in February 2010.
On 24 October 2019, an improvised explosive device (IED) planted by unidentified assailants detonated outside the house of a mayor in Canelar, Zamboanga City. Nobody was hurt in the incident.

source: Philippine News Agency; Philippine Daily Inquirer
notes: On 24 October 2019, an unidentified assailant hurled an anti-personnel mine at the municipal police station of Quezon, Bukidnon, damaging the building's roof, windows and wall, as well as a vehicle. The local government later pinned the attack on the NPA. There were no reported casualties.

On 24 October 2019, seven militants of the MILF were wounded when an IED planted by suspected BIFF militants detonated in Barangay Dasawao, Shariff Saydona Mustapha, Maguindanao. The MILF had been helping the military in chasing BIFF militants and had just overrun a BIFF camp in the area hours earlier. The MILF recently began decommissioning its weapons as part of the 2014 peace plan. In recent years, they have assisted the military in fighting Islamist groups in the region.
Two drug suspects were killed during a police raid in Barangay Tungkong Mangga, San Jose del Monte, Bulacan on 24 October 2019.
On 25 October 2019, animal rights activists demonstrated in support of veganism as a response to climate change at the Andres Bonifacio Shrine in Manila. [size=no report]

On 25 October 2019, a village chief was gunned down by an assailant in Allacapan, Cagayan after the former confronted the latter's family for illegal fishing activity (electrocution). The village chief had reportedly shot and wounded one of the assailant's companions by accident beforehand, after which a scuffle for the gun ensued.
Two drug suspects were killed in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified assailants at the Bautista Compound in Barangay Alabang, Muntinlupa on 25 October 2019.
On 25 October 2019, a farmer was killed and his son was wounded in an attack by unidentified motorcycle-riding assailants in Barangay Nambaran, Santo Domingo, Ilocos Sur.
A drug suspect was killed during a shootout with the police in Barangay Bagong Bayan, Pililla, Rizal on 25 October 2019. One police officer was killed during the shootout.
A drug suspect was killed during a shootout with the police in Barangay Real, Calamba, Laguna on 25 October 2019. One police officer was wounded during the shootout.

On 25 October 2019, the military carried out an airstrike on an NPA camp in Barangay Batang Bagras, Palimbang, Sultan Kudarat. The NPA, which reportedly counted a number of casualties, deserted the camp as the military took over.

On 25 October 2019, a government forest ranger of the Community Environment and Natural Resources Office of Munoz, Nueva Ecija was shot dead by unidentified assailants in the said town. The forest ranger had led a surveillance operation against illegal logging activities in a nearby town just a few days prior.

source: Philippine Star; Sunstar (Philippines); Cebu Daily News; Rappler
notes: On 25 October 2019, a town mayor arrested the previous day for attacking a masseur was shot dead by unidentified assailants along M. Velez St. outside the Office of the Ombudsman in Cebu City, while in police custody. The victim was being transported by the police to the city prosecutor's office for inquest proceedings when the attack took place. The victim had earlier figured in a list of 'narco-politicians' released by President Rodrigo Duterte to the public in March 2019. Two police officers and three civilians were also injured in the attack against the mayor.
Two drug suspects were killed while two others were arrested during a police raid in Barangay Tayud, Consolacion, Cebu on 26 October 2019. A policeman was wounded during the shootout
Two drug suspects were killed in a police raid in Barangay Santa Ana, San Pablo, Laguna on 26 October 2019.

On 26 October 2019, the military carried out an airstrike on an NPA camp in Barangay Caputoan, Las Navas, Northern Samar. There was an undetermined number of casualties on the NPA side; the military reported finding blood stains as they took over the camp from the fleeing rebels. The military also reported retrieving several weapons and other items.
On 27 October 2019, a police asset was shot dead by unidentified assailants in Barangay Hulo, Mandaluyong. The victim had been in jail on drug charges and had just been released.

assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Citizen Armed Force Geographical Unit
notes: On 27 October 2019, an active auxiliary of the Civilian Armed Forces Geographical Unit (CAFGU) was shot dead by suspected NPA militants at his home in Barangay Batangan, Valencia, Bukidnon. CAFGU auxiliary at home and assumed off-duty.

On 26-27 October 2019, 29 drug suspects were arrested in simultaneous police operations across the province of Quezon as part of its 'Simultaneous Anti-Criminality and Law Enforcement Operations (SACLEO).' The 29 arrests were part of the 297 total arrests that included other crimes, such as illegal gambling, illegal possession of firearms, violations of local ordinances, etc.
On 28 October 2019, a village chief was wounded in an attack by unidentified assailants in Barangay 116, Pasay City.

assoc_actor_1: ACT: Alliance of Concerned Teachers; Teachers (Philippines)
notes: On 28 October 2019, teachers from the Alliance of Concerned Teachers demonstrated in Halloween-themed costumes at the premises of the Department of Budget and Management in Manila in order to demand for higher wages for teachers. [size=no report]

On 28 October 2019, students from different universities and organizations held a silent demonstration in Baguio City to mark the 40th day since the death of a Philippine Military Academy cadet who died due to hazing. The students called on the military to put an end to the practice of hazing in the academy. [size=no report]
A drug suspect was wounded during a police raid at the reclamation area in Mandaue, Cebu on 29 October 2019.

assoc_actor_1: BAYAN: Bagong Alyansang Makabayan; KARAPATAN: Alliance for the Advancement of People's Rights
notes: On 29 October 2019, groups such as KARAPATAN, BAYAN and their supporters demonstrated against the government's war on drugs in front of the Philippine National Police headquarters at Camp Crame, Quezon City. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_2: Former Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-)
notes: On 29 October 2019, a former police officer was shot dead by unidentified assailants along the Poblacion highway in Santa Maria, Ilocos Sur.

On 29 October 2019, two representatives of a car dealership driving a police patrol car were wounded in an IED attack by suspected NPA militants between the villages of Lale and Pahug in Pinabacdao, Samar. The two victims were driving the patrol car to deliver it to the police.

assoc_actor_2: KMP: Kilusang Magbubukid ng Pilipinas; Farmers (Philippines)
notes: On 29 October 2019, a farmer-organizer affiliated with the Kilusang Magbubukid ng Pilipinas (KMP) was shot dead by unidentified assailants in Barangay Vintar, Valencia, Bukidnon.

On 30 October 2019, families of the victims of drug-related violence and their supporters held a demonstration and celebrated Mass led by Catholic priests in Mendiola, Manila to call for justice for their slain kin and for an end to extrajudicial killings. [size=no report]

On 30 October 2019, seven government soldiers were wounded in clashes with Abu Sayyaf militants in Barangays Pangdanon and Tanum in Patikul, Sulu. There was an undetermined number of casualties on the Abu Sayyaf side. The army reported capturing an Abu Sayyaf camp and retrieving weapons and other items after the clash in Barangay Pangdanon.

actor1: Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Criminal Investigation and Detection Group
notes: On 30 October 2019, a village chief heading the Association of Barangay Captains (ABC) of his town, as well as one of his companions, were killed in a shootout with police operatives of the Criminal Investigation and Detection Group (CIDG) in Barangay Mapitogo, Balud, Masbate. The CIDG operatives were carrying out anti-illegal gambling operations when the shootout happened with the village chief's group, which reportedly included armed men. The village chief had been suspected of being involved in illegal gambling.

assoc_actor_2: NUJP: National Union of Journalists of the Philippines; Journalists (Philippines)
source: Abante; GMA News; Manila Bulletin; Philippine Star
notes: On 30 October 2019, a radio broadcaster was critically wounded in an attack by unidentified assailants in Barangay New Isabela, Tacurong, Sultan Kudarat. The broadcaster, who was a member of the National Union of Journalists of the Philippines, died at the hospital more than a month later because of his injuries.
On 30 October 2019, a village chief was wounded in an attack by unidentified assailants in Barangay 10, Pasay City.
On 30 October 2019, suspected NPA militants burned a three-classroom building at a school in Barangay Sapu Masla, Malapatan, Sarangani, according to the military.

actor1: Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Criminal Investigation and Detection Group
assoc_actor_2: Bayan Muna; GABRIELA: General Assembly Binding Women for Reforms, Integrity, Equality, Leadership, and Action; KARAPATAN: Alliance for the Advancement of People's Rights; KMU: Kilusang Mayo Uno; Makabayan: Patriotic Coalition of the People; NFSW: National Federation of Sugar Workers; Civilians (United States)
source: Amnesty International; Bulatlat; Manila Bulletin; Philippine Daily Inquirer; Rappler; CNN
notes: On 31 October 2019, 56 individuals belonging to different organizations - Bayan Muna, GABRIELA, KARAPATAN, Kilusang Mayo Uno, Makabayan, and the National Federation of Sugar Workers - were arrested in simultaneous operations in Barangays Bata, Taculing, and 33 in Bacolod City, Negros Occidental. The arrests were carried out by the Philippine National Police's Criminal Investigation and Detection Group in coordination with the army, Joint Task Force Negros, and the provincial police. The arrested individuals belonged to organizations that have often been red-tagged by the military. The arrests were carried out on charges of illegal possession of firearms and explosives, though the organizations concerned said that the evidence was planted. The arrests, while defended by authorities as a legitimate operation with the necessary arrest warrants, were described as a crackdown on leftist groups and were condemned by various national and international organizations, such as the organizations' umbrella alliance BAYAN and independent organizations like Amnesty International. A US citizen was also one of the arrested, leading the US labor union she is part of to call for her release.
Two drug suspects were killed during a police raid in Barangay Gaya-gaya, San Jose del Monte, Bulacan on 31 October 2019.
